intro: Nothofagus gunnii, commonly known as the silver兜兰, is a species of evergreen tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Nothofagaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and distinctive cone-like fruits. The tree typically grows in cool, moist environments such as forests and highland areas. It plays an important role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
